intro: Rousseauxia marojejensis subsp. sericea, commonly known as the sericea rousseauxia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native environment.
